title: [BUG] running `examples/03_classification_multivariate.ipynb` fails in CI
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->

Some recent changes made are triggering this notebook failue in CI. Discovered in #1620 after rebasing on the latest master.

```bash
nbclient.exceptions.CellExecutionError: An error occurred while executing the following cell:
------------------
clf = ColumnEnsembleClassifier(
    estimators=[
        ("TSF0", TimeSeriesForestClassifier(n_estimators=100), [0]),
        ("BOSSEnsemble3", BOSSEnsemble(max_ensemble_size=5), [3]),
    ]
)
clf.fit(X_train, y_train)
clf.score(X_test, y_test)
------------------

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
/tmp/ipykernel_2217/3652702281.py in <module>
      6 )
      7 clf.fit(X_train, y_train)
----> 8 clf.score(X_test, y_test)

/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sktime/classification/base.py in score(self, X, y)
    210 
    211         # boilerplate input checks for predict-like methods
--> 212         X = self._check_convert_X_for_predict(X)
    213 
    214         return accuracy_score(y, self.predict(X), normalize=True)

/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sktime/classification/base.py in _check_convert_X_for_predict(self, X)
    237         unequal = not self.metadata_["is_equal_length"]
    238         # Check this classifier can handle characteristics
--> 239         self._check_capabilities(missing, multivariate, unequal)
    240         # Convert data as dictated by the classifier tags
    241         X = self._convert_X(X)

/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.7.12/x64/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sktime/classification/base.py in _check_capabilities(self, missing, multivariate, unequal)
    353             # compatibility with the testing functions
    354             raise ValueError(
--> 355                 "X must be univariate, this classifier cannot deal with "
    356                 "multivariate input."
    357             )

ValueError: X must be univariate, this classifier cannot deal with multivariate input.
ValueError: X must be univariate, this classifier cannot deal with multivariate input.
```

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
jupyter nbconvert --to notebook --inplace --execute --ExecutePreprocessor.timeout=600 examples/03_classification_multivariate.ipynb
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
